definition: half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from

sentences.english: Half a dozen seasoned Dreadfort men guarded the doors of the Great Keep.
sentences.chinese: 半打的久经沙场的恐怖堡亲兵守卫着大监狱的大门。

sentences.english: Open the oysters — he suggests two dozen Kushi, but the quantity and type is up to you.
sentences.chinese: 打开牡蛎，他建议半打，质量和类型取决于你自己。

sentences.english: The lady took him by the hand and went into the store, and asked the clerk to get a half dozen pairs of socks for the boy.
sentences.chinese: 女士牵着他的手走进了商店，让店员去取半打棉袜。

sentences.english: In the case of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, she may need at least a half-dozen envoys.
sentences.chinese: 对于巴以冲突，她可能需要至少半打特使。

sentences.english: Half a dozen of the top clubs are for sale. No one wants to buy, though.
sentences.chinese: 半打顶级俱乐部待价而沽，但却没有买家。

definition: take-out (fast food)/(outer part of) tire/as well/besides/into the bargain/outer zone
